British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his partner, Carrie Symonds, are expecting a child this summer, the BBC reported.
The unwed couple the first to occupy 10 Downing Street will marry, a spokesperson told the BBC, though it is unclear if that will occur… [+33 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Tony Romm
title: State Department examination of Twitter found millions of coronavirus tweets pushed false information
description: Roughly 2 million tweets peddled conspiracy theories and other falsehoods about coronavirus in other countries over the roughly two-week period when the outbreak began to spread outside China, according to a report from an arm of State Department obtained by …
content: The Global Engagement Center, the propaganda-fighting program at the State Department whose name appears on the document, said it focused its analysis on countries excluding the United States between Jan. 20 and Feb. 10, a period during which the World Health… [+4272 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Associated Press
title: Socialist hardliners aim guns on Guaid march in Venezuela
description: Socialist hardliners in Venezuela opened fire during a march headed by Juan Guaidó, adding to tensions in the country as the opposition leader seeks to revive his campaign to oust Nicolás Maduro
content: The confusing incident Saturday in the central city of Barquisimeto is believed to be the first time pro-government vigilantes known as colectivos have aimed a weapon at Guaidó, who the U.S. and more than 50 other countries recognize as Venezuelas rightful le… [+2591 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Miriam Berger
title: The protest banners of Kafranbel, Syria, were once the symbols of a revolution. Now Assad's forces have retaken the town.
description: Around one million Syrians have been displaced in Assad's last push to win the war.
content: On Tuesday, Kafranbel fell back into the hands of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, whose forces are waging war across Idlib to regain the last main rebel-held part of Syria. The fighting has displaced nearly a million people, more than half of them children.… [+1008 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Associated Press
title: Virus fears keep hundreds of cruise passengers at sea
description: Operators of a British cruise ship that was turned away from its destination due to fears of the new coronavirus say they've chartered planes to ferry passengers home
content: Fred. Olsen Cruise Lines issued statements insisting that nobody aboard had symptoms consistent with the COVID-19 illness. Dominican officials had refused to allow the vessel into port due to what the company said were a very small number of influenza-like ca… [+998 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Darlene Superville, AP
title: Trump says getting rid of "bad" people made him successful
description: President Donald Trump says his "journey" as president is successful because he got rid of people he says are "bad."
content:
OXON HILL, Md. President Donald Trump said Saturday that his journey in the nations highest office would have been a failure had he not be able to rid the government of people he says are bad.
Trump came into office railing against what he and his allies cal… [+2523 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Sam Fortier
title: Starlin Castro welcomes loftier expectations, and the Nationals are counting on him to deliver
description: The Nationals need him to sustain his second-half success from last season to help fill a void in the lineup.
content: Last season was one of the most difficult of his career. He played all 162 games, and the Marlins won just 57 of them. Manager Don Mattingly tried to give Castro days off, but he wouldnt take them because he wanted to lead the team while it was rebuilding, hi… [+4340 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Yasmeen Abutaleb,
title: Inside Trump’s frantic attempts to minimize the coronavirus crisis
description: As cases mounted, the White House scrambled to gain control of a rudderless response defined by bureaucratic infighting, confusion and misinformation.
content: But when Trump took to the lectern for a news conference intended to bring transparency to the spiraling global crisis, he made no explicit mention of the California case and its implications and falsely suggested the virus might soon be eradicated in the Uni… [+13656 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Steven Goff
title: D.C. United’s fresh new look fades to disappointment in season-opening loss
description: Visiting Colorado took control in the final 20 minutes and came from behind for a 2-1 victory on MLS opening day.
content:
Disappointed, Coach Ben Olsen said, but we are a work in progress and its a long season.
It could feel much longer if United does not better manage the last stage of matches. Russell Canouse had provided the lead in the 60th minute, but Kei Kamara equalized … [+4560 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Barry Svrluga
title: Juan Soto’s power made him a household name. His plate discipline could make him an all-timer.
description: The young outfielder has walked at a rate never seen for a player his age in major league history.
content:
A steak, in dugout parlance, is an RBI. (RBI = rib-eye. Get it?) Soto knew exactly what Kendrick was asking.
I like em, Soto responded. But they werent strikes.
And if a pitch isnt a strike, Soto, in more dugout parlance, spits at it. For all the damage the… [+6711 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

content: Black voters made up a majority of the primary voters, and they favored Biden over Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) by about 4 to 1, according to preliminary exit poll data. Biden appeared to have a small lead over Sanders in white voters. Former South Bend, Ind.,… [+213 chars]

author: Scott Clement
title: South Carolina Democratic primary exit polls and analysis
description: See the strengths and weaknesses of each Democratic candidate from a survey of voters as they exited randomly selected voting sites.

author: Nitasha Tiku
title: Uber, Lyft drivers face the spread of coronavirus with no safety net
description: Drivers for Uber and Lyft and delivery people for Instacart and DoorDash are independent contractors and don’t get sick leave or healthcare benefits.
content: Alva said the company has not communicated with drivers yet about the novel coronavirus, despite the risk of infection. No support, no advice, no guidance regarding what we do if we suspect any indicators of the problem, said Alva, who added that he has been … [+6597 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post
